Detailed Description

The CamcorderProfile class is used to retrieve the predefined camcorder profile settings for camcorder applications.

These settings are read-only.

The compressed output from a recording session with a given CamcorderProfile contains two tracks: one for auido and one for video.

Each profile specifies the following set of parameters:

  • The file output format
  • Video codec format
  • Video bit rate in bits per second
  • Video frame rate in frames per second
  • Video frame width and height,
  • Audio codec format
  • Audio bit rate in bits per second,
  • Audio sample rate
  • Number of audio channels for recording.

Member Function Documentation

static CamcorderProfile gaia::media::CamcorderProfile::get ( CamcorderProfileQuality  quality) [static]

Returns the camcorder profile for the first back-facing camera on the device at the given quality level.

If the device has no back-facing camera, this returns null.

Parameters:
qualitythe target quality level for the camcorder profile
See also:
#get(int, int)
static CamcorderProfile gaia::media::CamcorderProfile::get ( int32_t  cameraId,
CamcorderProfileQuality  quality 
) [static]

Returns the camcorder profile for the given camera at the given quality level.

Quality levels QUALITY_LOW, QUALITY_HIGH are guaranteed to be supported, while other levels may or may not be supported. The supported levels can be checked using

See also:
#hasProfile(int, int). QUALITY_LOW refers to the lowest quality available, while QUALITY_HIGH refers to the highest quality available. QUALITY_LOW/QUALITY_HIGH have to match one of qcif, cif, 480p, 720p, or 1080p. E.g. if the device supports 480p, 720p, and 1080p, then low is 480p and high is 1080p.

The same is true for time lapse quality levels, i.e. QUALITY_TIME_LAPSE_LOW, QUALITY_TIME_LAPSE_HIGH are guaranteed to be supported and have to match one of qcif, cif, 480p, 720p, or 1080p.

A camcorder recording session with higher quality level usually has higher output bit rate, better video and/or audio recording quality, larger video frame resolution and higher audio sampling rate, etc, than those with lower quality level.

Parameters:
cameraIdthe id for the camera
qualitythe target quality level for the camcorder profile.
